They find that taking vitamins C and E, in the daily amounts of 1 g and 300 mg, sufferers of type 2 diabetes are much better able to handle inflammatory stress. But why? Is type 2 diabetes simply an out-of-control inflammatory situation, which therefore any antioxidant might improve?

They say having too much of the hormone leptin associates with increased susceptibility to type 2 diabetes; but vitamins C and E have been shown to down-regulate leptin; and this is one of the ways these vitamins attenuate the inflammatory response.

And indeed the purpose of the study, essentially, was to see what happens if the inflammation that is the cornerstone of the diabetic pathology was diminished.
